title: EPA Plans to Shut Down the Energy Star Program
summary:
EPA Plans to Shut Down the Energy Star Program

The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) plans to eliminate the Energy Star program, which has been promoting energy efficiency in home appliances for over 33 years. The program's recognizable blue label has helped households and businesses save more than $500 billion in energy costs and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. The EPA's reorganization includes the elimination of the Energy Star program and the climate change office, as well as the division that oversees Energy Star. The Energy Star program has been credited with changing the way Americans shop by encouraging manufacturers to make products that use less power.
